techmeme.title: AT&T says it will begin notifying consumers about a data breach that allowed cybercriminals to steal phone records of "nearly all" of its customers (Zack Whittaker/TechCrunch)
Preliminary findings: the EU says X's paid blue checkmark deceives users and breaches the DSA; X faces a fine of up to 6% of its global revenue if found guilty (Javier Espinoza/Financial Times)
Hanover, Germany-based HERO Software, whose SaaS acts as an operating system for trade SMEs like plumbing, raised a €40M Series B led by Eight Roads Ventures (Cate Lawrence/Tech.eu)
Some devs remain optimistic as Apple seeks a "killer app" for Vision Pro; Appfigures: the number of new Vision Pro apps has fallen since January and February (Financial Times)
Asia-based startups raised only $14.6B in Q2 2024, down 24% from Q1 and 32% YoY, with only 1,511 funding deals announced in Q2, down 15% from Q1 and 27% YoY (Chris Metinko/Crunchbase News)
